p: Direct unit costs include direct medical costs such as diagnostic tests, drugs and medications, and medical personnel salaries and fringe benefits. Nonmedical costs include costs such as transport, lodging, or food. The main source of indirect costs of dengue is work-time loss (i.e., productivity loss) caused by disability and, in some cases, death. The resources and time spent by the patientsâ€™ caregivers are also included in the nonmedical direct and indirect unit costs of dengue ( Shepard et al., 2014).
